modules.description: This library enables streaming JSON encoding of primitives, arrays, and objects through combinators that sequence encoders and build nested structures. It operates on a stateful context to incrementally generate JSON, ideal for scenarios like real-time data serialization or handling large datasets where memory efficiency is critical. The design supports custom type conversions and iterative list encoding, allowing dynamic construction of JSON payloads without full in-memory representation.

This module provides combinators for incrementally encoding JSON values, supporting streaming output of primitives, arrays, and objects. It works with a stateful context to serialize data structures iteratively, enabling efficient handling of large datasets or real-time data streams. Concrete use cases include generating JSON payloads from database query results or network streams without loading the entire dataset into memory.
